name: discriminatorily
content:
Add to word list
Add to word list
in a way that treats a person or group of people differently from, and usually worse than other people, because of their skin colour, sex, sexuality, etc.: She alleges that she was discriminatorily denied a promotion. They are concerned about whether employers might get access to the information and use it discriminatorily.
More examplesFewer examplesSuch a rule could be applied discriminatorily.Risk assessment is discriminatorily applied to people with disabilities. The courts have consistently ruled that if a person acts discriminatorily, even without intending to, such conduct will be unlawful.
